page.title: 08Education in Hexham.
page.content: buses or taxis.112/3 teachers have 8 classes for 8 lessons a day,and they teach specialised subjects in the third and fourth years.It caters for the needs of Catholic families in the area.The uniform is brown and orange {Queen Elizabeth High School}was first granted a charter in 1599.It is housed in 2 buildings now.The Hydro,built in 1878,and the school,built in 1965.At the top of the pyramaid,it educates 1020 pupils of 13 to 18+,with some mature students,and has 64 teachers including the head.25 subjects are taught-arts,science and technology with G.C.E.'O'and'A'level exams at the end of the course.Pupils come from a big catchment area-Tynedale,Allendale, Hexhamshire-by bus.The site including playing fields is 6 acres.8 kitchen staff cook the dinner cafeteria style.
